intro: Hieracium declivium, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Hieracium declivium is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
